Reviews.Content: Bella Firenze This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. Our first experience was positive so we decided to try them again but this time we stayed for two weeks using Florence as our base to explore the city and region. The staff could not have been more helpful and pleasant. The room they gave us was quite large and well appointed. The only criticism was the quite appalling coffee that was served in the morning! Apart from that the place was fine. The location did not bother us as we like to walk and explore 'off the beaten track' and we also used the excellent bus service. There are good restaurants in the area especially a Ristorante/Pizzeria called La Luna which was excellent. Hotel Jane is highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: ncltob

Reviews.Content: Typical Midpriced Euro Hotel Stayed at the Hotel Jane a while back. While it is not a bad hotel, it is small and different than what the typical american is looking for. I had been living in Europe so I was used to these differences, but took my parents while in town. They were dissappointed at what passes for a typical mid-priced euro hotel. Pro's, quiet area, not too rowdy when I was there, there was a charming restaurant down the street with a small outdoor seating section to enjoy a quite Florentine evening as a local might, rather than the busier, hustle and bustle sections.the older lady who was in charge of the breakfast bar, was a trip. she was like one of the little old italian ladies in the first godfather while Michael is in Sicily. She was curt by friendly, and always kept an eye on you... as if you might walk off with an unaccounted for danish... Cons: A/C in europe doesn't usually meet american standards, Hotel Jane is no different, it was quite warm in July, don't expect to come back to a crisp cool 68 degree room... haSmall bathrooms are also the norm in the european side of the world, again Hotel jane, no different.Parking can be a pain if you come and go during the day, if you are not parked by a certian time at night, forget about it.Overall it is a hotel that can allow you to save some cash if you book at the right time and will allow you to spend more on other Florence/Tuscany things to do. But nothing to write home about. Some other reviewers have commented on the staff... honestly their negative impressions were a surprise, the management when I was there seemed to blend in with the walls.
Reviews.Author: MD4now

Reviews.Content: Loved Florence, shame about the Hotel Having come back from a 4 night stay in lovely Florence the experience would've been much better if the level of service had been as good as Florence itself. On check in we were given a room on the top floor right next to the lifts. As soon as we walked into the room we were disgusted with the size and the whole feel of it. The walls were paper thin and having the lift right next to it we were not gonna get any sleep. We went straight back to reception and luckily they changed the room to downstairs next to the reception. The room was bigger and even had a balcony area which was nice, apart from that the room was standard.The room was quite cold so we wanted to put the heating on, but was told by reception that the heating comes on automatically at 7pm and nothing we can do about it!! So we just had to put on a couple of layers on until we were warmer. Each night we must have got no more that 6 hours sleep, me and the missus enjoy staying up late drinking and chilling out so enjoy having a lye in but this was not to happen as you can hear the night staff snoring away in the room next door and everyone gathering in reception talking loudly for no reason at all early morning at 6am!! So having a lye in was NOT an option at Hotel Jane.After a long day walking we came back to the hotel and fancied a hot beverage so went to reception and asked for a hot chocolate. We were told that we cannot order any hot drinks until after 8pm and guess what time it was? 7.55pm For the sake of 5mins they refused to serve us hot drinks as apparently they only serve it for 2 hours in the evening!! I have never heard any rubbish!! They had actually asked us to come back rather than take our order and serve us after 8pm!! In the end we decided to go to the nearest cafe and spend our money there instead. The day before we were leaving we were rudely advised by an elderly member of staff on reception that dont forget to check out by 11am tomorrow, considering our flight was at 10am we were fully aware of what time to check out. Instead of making you feel welcome they didnt appear that bothered with our custom. Overall we had a fantastic time in Florence, it could've been a better remembered holiday if the hotel service was good. My advise is to spend that little bit extra and go elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: Nikhil_V

Reviews.Content: Don't Bother... Not Worth the Money Though the location of the hotel was fine... away from the tourist trap center, the hotel has MUCH to be desired. The staff was rude and unfriendly. I have traveled for many years and stayed in a variety of upscale and lowbrow hotels, inns, and BB's, and I've never been received with such disrespect. And my husband and I are EXCEEDINGLY low maintenance, which is why we picked this hotel!!! When I asked if they could suggest a local restaurant to celebrate my husband's birthday or secure a taxi to the local golf course, they informed me that they were only a three star hotel and that I should find another hotel if I required those types of services! Moreover, they added, they were not making a profit off of our room since we had booked with a travel agency far in advance of the high season!! And we stayed for 10 days!!! They also refused to hold my husband's valuables in the hotel safe. They were just as rude to the other guests, barking at what table one could /could not sit at for breakfast. I was scared to even make eye contact with the staff for fear I was bothering them, whether it was for a second cup of coffee or asking for directions to the local bank. In the spirit of their you're not profitable guests attitude, we were given a TINY room next to the elevator --even after I had requested a room away from the noisy elevator--with an even tinier shower. Obviously NOT built for the average 5'6, 140 lb person. Imagine showering in an upright coffin, except there's actually more room in a coffin. It was impossible to shower without bruised elbows. The room air conditioning and breakfast was the only thing worthy of mention in this hotel. Breakfast was actually good and filling (bread, cold-cuts, cereals, juice, yogurt, cappuccino), considering the bad attitude, surliness, and ill-mannered personnel. The night staff, though not as rude, didn't speak English. We had to literally mime for a 7:00 AM wake-up call! The free internet service is also a scam. One computer for use by two hotels, and it wasn't even housed at the Hotel Jane. Florence is glorious, the food magnificent, it's people warm and gracious. This hotel however is an embarrassment to such a beautiful city and it's people. I would never recommend this hotel, EVER.
Reviews.Author: Omancamo

Reviews.Content: Somewhat disappointed After reading the other reviews, I was fully prepared to be very happy at this hotel. And as the hotel goes, it was fine. It has A/C, which was certainly welcomed, as it was unseasonably hot. However, I was somewhat underwhelmed with the night staff. I had a very important phone call to make, and apparently couldn't use a phone card from the room. They also advertise WiFi, which I couldn't get on. I wouldn't know whether there was phone card usage or WiFi because I couldn't get the night clerk away from his television set long enough to answer my questions. Very disappointed in this hotel and would not go back.
Reviews.Author: sandyavs

Reviews.Content: A cracking hotel! Have just returned from a 4 stay at this hotel. Booked it after reading reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. Bright room, clean bathroom, fluffy towels each day and good choice of continental breakfast. Though we had only booked a triple room we found ourselves in a generous quadruple- great for three girls and all their luggage!Staff were all friendly and helpful, including the older gentleman on the front desk. Despite his limited english (certainly better than our Italian!) he made us feel very welcome and helped us out on many occasions. There is a lot of noise from traffic and other guests, but we had experienced this in other Italian hotels. The 15-20min walk to and from town along the riverbank is very picturesque. On days you are too knackered to face it, it's useful to know that the no. 14 bus stops around the corner from the hotel. It comes approx. every 15mins and drops you off at handy places, like the Duomo and the train station. Would definately stay here again- great value for money.
Reviews.Author: Geordiegals3

Reviews.Content: A good place for the money We went to Florence in late March. We got lucky with the weather considering there is a lot of walking to be done. The hotel was in the east side of Florence. It was about 20 minutes to walk to the center of town near the Duomo. The area were David is, was about 20 minutes also. The hotel is in a good neighborhood. It is 4 blocks away from the river. Walking along it takes you to the Ponte Vecchio. About a 15 minute walk. If coming from the train station, take the 14 bus located outside of the train station. Be VERY careful on the buses, we saw someone get pick-pocketed. It gets crowded and people don't realize they are being robbed from b/c it is so tight anyway. The room was small but the bathroom was great for European standards. The room we had downstairs was not ideal. The walls were paper thin b/c we were apparently next to the office. So on shift changes, it was noisy. In particularly at bedtime, as late as 11pm. After the first night, it wasn't as bad. Francesca was very helpful at the front desk. In the evening, the people knew less English but they got by. There is free internet across the street at their sister hotel. That was great and no one else was ever using it. They had a light breakfast but it was good. They made great cappucino. Go to La Taverna, about 3 blocks away, for dinner. Reasonable prices and close. Ask the front desk how to get there. I would recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Marylandtraveller07

Reviews.Content: Can't complain about much The oher reviews are pretty accurate. The rooms are basic but clean. The bathroom small and it is true that you can hear everything! The breakfast was fine and the staff helpful. At the end of the day yoiu get what you pay for and it was good value for the money.
Reviews.Author: lad4495

Reviews.Content: Plain Jane Hotel The Hotel Jane is pretty basic for a 3 star. I can confirm all other reviews on different sites which comment on the noise level. You can hear EVERYTHING from other rooms and contrary to what the Italian website says, the rooms are definitely NOT soundproofed. Avoid room no 19, it must be the worst, next to the lift and the stairs which people clatter (they are stone stairs) up and down early and late. Also this 'double' room is too small for more than one person to stand up in. if you want to unpack or dress, your room mate must stay on the bed. The disgusting orange walls don't help either. Everything said about size of bathrooms is accurate too. You can only stand sideways in the shower. Apart from breakfast which is average there is no service in this hotel. I was unwell for one day and didn't go out. You can't get a glass of water, never mind a cup of coffee. There is a small bar and seating area but I never saw any service there at any time in 5 days. The only good points are the towels which are huge and plentiful and the female staff who are lovely (not so the man)If you want any comfort to relax in after your sightseeing, stay somewhere else!
Reviews.Author: dianagray

Reviews.Content: Jane was warm and friendly Hotel Jane was very nice. The room was a larger one than the one we had in Rome. Our room was painted in a cheerful Tuscan pallete of bright earth tones. Writing Desk and two chairs were included as well as a fridge and mini-bar (which we did not use). We had a rear view of some gardens in the neighborhood. Bathroom was small but who cares? There were plenty of fluffy towels and hot water.On the plus side the breakfast was great, and varied from rolls and croissants to cereal, breakfast meats of salumi and mortadella and cheeses, to fresh fruit and yogurts. Coffee was great, nice and strong.There really wern't any minuses except distance from Centro Storica back to the hotel after a full day and evening of walking around this beautiful city. That's our fault, though, as we didn't learn the bus routes until the morning we left.There are several very nice restaurants, trattorias, osterias and pizzerias in the immediate neighborhood (Santa Croce).The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The night porter didn't have English so it's perhaps a good idea to learn some Italian before leaving home or keep a phrase book handy if you need to ask a question after 8pm. We managed quite well with a few basic phrases, as most people spoke excellent English in the service trades (restaurants, retail, and museums).We liked Hotel Jane very much and would book a room there again should we revisit Florence.
Reviews.Author: Jim_Naughton

Reviews.Content: Great Holiday We have just returned from a trip to Florence and stayed at Hotel Jane. We arrived at the hotel late in the evening and the reception promptly showed us our quadruple room - we have two children aged 6 and 12. It was a nice, comfortable large room with one double bed and two single beds. Very nicely decorated and the ensuite bathroom (shower) was very clean. The room was cleaned thoroughly every day. Breakfast was very good, you can order capuccino, espresso, etc., included in price. Breakfast consisted of cereals, bread, cold ham and cheese cuts. There were also croissants and cakes, orange, peach and pear juices and sparkling and still water. Staff were always very helpful and courteous. Hotel Jane is a family friendly hotel. Although the centre of the city is about 20 minutes walk away, we did not mind because our street was very quiet, as opposed to the centre. We would definitely recommend Hotel Jane.
Reviews.Author: AlexisMalta

Reviews.Content: Too far from main area You get what you pay for... so when my husband booked this hotel at a low price, I should've known it wouldn't be the typical modern, nice hotel we're used to. Hotel is pretty far from the central area of Florence. We had to buy bus passes every day to get to the main area. There wasn't much opened around the hotel when we were there, end of Aug-Beg Sept. If we could go back, I wouldn't book this hotel- not that we had major problems, b/c we didn't. I guess the main prob i had was the location. Another prob I couldn't believe was that the older gentleman at the front desk also added to the not so great stay... when we asked if the hotel had internet connection, he flat out said NO, eventhough we read on this site that the sister hotel had internet. No idea why he coldly told us No. Normally i'm never one to complain about a hotel or to regret booking a hotel, but Florence should have been an amazing stay... unfortunately it wasn't.
Reviews.Author: lizzieNJ

Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money if not for one big minus The noise in this place was the only problem. Walls etc. must be paper thin. Besides from this, we found the hotel to be absolutely great value for money (stayed 5 nights at EUR 60 per ninght per double). Except perhaps from the elderly man at the reception, staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was small (but not tiny), clean and comfortable with a balcony overlooking the street. Our bathroom was modern and in good shape and small but not at all tiny. Breakfast (continental buffet) was nothing special but not bad in any way. Location is not really that bad with plenty of restaurants and shopping around. We were 4 minutes walk from where the centre map of Lonely Planet starts - and from there another 10-15 minutes walk to the heart of the centre and the main sights. We stayed 5 nights but never bothered taking the bus. Europe was made for walking - at least in at our age group (29-32) I have to say that walking the 15-20 minutes to Ponte Vecchio would be hard to consider an achievement. All in all would recommend this place as good value for money.
Reviews.Author: Jkortsen

Reviews.Content: pretty nice! From our hotel in Rome, when we got to Florence, we felt like Kings!! The bathroom was a good size!! The room was a good size with a balcony that faced the street---looked great! The bed was strange--two twins pushed together--couldn't feel it too much. The breakfast was great with great service and the food was good compared to my last hotel since I got Juice, Fruits, Yogurt, some meat! YUM! Interent service next door!! Close to the bus stop...we actually walked to pointe vecchio so it was not too bad!
Reviews.Author: Cleanhotelplease

Reviews.Content: First visit to Florence Great first Italy visiting experience. Convenient yet quiet area. Be prepared to do a lot of walking to the historic district. Charming narrow streets. Was very hot in 07/06 but worth it.Charles K. Miller (Biff.pa52@gmail.com)
Reviews.Author: Biff_pa52

Reviews.Content: Great place for the money! We recently booked a trip to Italy through an on-line service and were a little apprehensive about the hotel bookings, but were pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Jane. The staff was incredibly friendly and very helpful in getting us situated, organizing tours, getting cabs and giving directions. The room was small, but charming with a little balcony overlooking the street. Beds were comfortable, the towels were fluffy and the breakfast was tasty The walls were thin and it's a little off the beaten path but those are the only negative factors we could identity. Would stay there again and would recommend to anyone.
Reviews.Author: katrinab98

Reviews.Content: Very Pleasant Hotel We stayed at Hotel Jane, from Monday the 20th November BB for our stay while in Florence. We found this lovely Hotel to be Very Friendly, Exeptionally Clean, The staff very helpfull, and nothing was to much trouble. The rooms though basic were cleaned everyday, with bedding and fresh towels daily. The shower room (no bath) and toilet etc, was very very clean. The breakfasts though continental was to a reasonable high standard, with plenty of choice, and you never felt hungry as there was always plenty. Once again the staff were lovely, warm and friendly, even though they struggled a little with english, we all muddled through, and got by. So it was a very enjoyable and comfortable stay while we were there. We would definetly go back, and wouldnt hesitate to recommend this small family run Hotel. It is a little way out, but you do see plenty of sights on your travels. The only thing i wished that they had was that they had drink making facilities in your bedroom to make a hot drink on your return back to your rooms. But they would make you drinks on request if you needed one. So you got by. There is plenty of shops around the area of Hotel Jane, and cafes, and restaurants, so you are never stuck for eating out etc. All in all a lovely stay, Florence was lovely. The area of Hotel Jane seemed safe when out and about, and everyone very warm and friendly.
Reviews.Author: Drean

Reviews.Content: Groovy digs This place was good for $102. U.S. in October for 2 people. We enjoyed our stay and the neighborhood is great. The first week we were there we didn't know there was upscale shopping at the top of the street. Eat at La Taverna and even cheaper and good was Le Stagioni for pastas and pizza (via Capi di Mondo 10R) up the street from Hotel Jane. Great shopping with Co-Op nearby. To get to Florence city center take any of the bus 14's a block and a half down and to the left from the hotel. Buy your bus ticket at the tabacci shop across the street 1.20 euros. Za Za's near the central market is a must for tuscan eating and next to it around the corner is Mario's lunch a local favorite (seafood friday lunch only). You may have to stand in line to get in but do it...Another for is the buffet at lunch is Grubbe Rose in Republique SquareBus back is 14 across from the train station or at the Duomo. Get off where La Taverna is and walk the rest of the way to the hotel. 2-3 blocks. Walls are thin but it is clean and just hope you don't get put near the party people. When we came back from Cinque Terre they put us in the back of the hotel where it was much quieter. Francesca speaks great English and is a great help. Good value and free breakfast with the typical cereals, yogurt and croissants. Ask and they will make you a cappaicinno.
Reviews.Author: jazzdaddio

Reviews.Content: OK but could do better Hotel Jane is within walking distance of the major sites and also near the bus 14 line. Our room was on the small side but the bathroom was incredibly small, especially the shower. You could barely climb into the shower through the combination sliding and folding shower door and you had to stand facing only one direction because there wasn't enough room to turn around. I swear the shower was less than 2 feet deep. If you were a large person I doubt that you would be able to use the shower. I will say that Hotel Jane had the nicest towels of any of our hotels while in Europe and the bed linens were quite nice. The cleaning was so-so. We found a pair of men's boxers which had fallen down along side of the desk and there was garbage lying on the floor which had not been vacuumed up. The carpet was quite soiled and needed a good steam cleaning. The front desk people were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was adequate but nothing special. If visiting Florence again I think I would try a different hotel.
Reviews.Author: AverageAmerican

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Hotel Jane My husband and I and our two teenage sons stayed at the Hotel Jane at the end of June 2006. The hotel is not new but it is certainly clean, had good breakfasts and the two young ladies who work at the front desk (Valeria  ??) were delightful and very helpful. Valeria, who speaks excellent english, suggested several places to dine and we enjoyed one (La Luna Pizzeria, just around the corner from the hotel) so much that we ate there twice during our four day stay! We also tried two other places Valeria suggested and those were both very good, as well. The first night we were there the A/C leaked but by the time we returned from our sightseeing the next day, it was fixed and didn't give us anymore problems. The bathrooms are a bit cozy but that seems to be the norm for Europe. This was, however, the only hotel that did not have a tub but a shower stall so at least the floor stayed dry. Also, the Hotel Jane does not have an internet connection, so they send guests to their sister hotel across the street. Unfortunately that hotel only has one computer so there could be a wait to use the computer. The hotel is about a 7 - 8 minute walk to the bus stop and a 20 minute bus ride from the main train station, so it could be worth taking a taxi if you have a lot of luggage - we lugged ours onto the bus during rush hour in the 100 degree heat when we arrived but took a taxi when we left! Overall, this hotel is clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfasts were good and the price was right. I would definitely stay there again - and eat at La Luna again!
Reviews.Author: happytraveler1965

Reviews.Content: good value Staff was very helpful. Not all of them spoke English, but they were very nice and circled places we should go on the map. Breakfast was good, rooms were small, but acceptable. 10 or 20 minute walk from all the attractions in Florence. They use something that smells awful to clean the bathrooms but it was gone after a few hours of open windows. Very good for the price, we would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: miso2006

Reviews.Content: quiet and cozy Hotel Jane was quiet, cozy, and very accomodating. if i needed blankets, pillows, towels,ect... and they also made all of my museum reservations for me, they also called me taxi's when i needed. i will stay there again if i am lucky enough to return to Florence. it was a very good experience. Italy was wonderful.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Value The staff at Hotel Jane were all very nice and extremely helpful. Several spoke English very well. Our room was very spacious. It had a comfortable king size bed, desk, minibar  dresser. The bathroom was a little small, but who cares -- shower, sink  toilet are all you need! Our room even had a small balcony. Which was useful as they kept the hotel a little too warm for us. It also had a ceiling fan  AC unit (which I'm sure works in the summer months). Breakfast was not extravagant, croissants, cereal, yogurt, ham  cheese, jams, juices,  coffee -- what you need to get you started in the morning. Overall we enjoyed our stay very much. They recommended a few local restaurants, specifically Taverna - excellent food  good prices! We even left our suitcases until 4 pm the day we left at no additional charge. Side Note - we are not slow walkers  it took us apprx 20 min to reach the Uffizi area. Hotel was a little farther from attractions than I thought. With all the good food  gelato we ate, the walking was good for us ! Would stay here again!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A pleasant stay We stayed the this hotel in March 2006 and I was impressed.The staff were very nice and although some could not speak English they were always at reception if we needed any assistance, and those that could speak English were most helpful. Breakfast was very nice and there was a good range. Our room was always clean and I would advise travellers to request rooms at the back of the hotel thus keeping traffic noise to a minimum.The storage space was adequate for us and there was also a room safe. The walk to the centre of Florence was wonderful and although the weather was very cold, it was always sunny and dry.There were very few restaurants nearby and these were usually closed from 6-7:30pm so we remained in the city centre where there were more restaurants and some were open during this time period. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would stay there again if we go back to Florence.
Reviews.Author: Priya01

Reviews.Content: Very nice for the price After staying in a true budget hotel in Rome, we were pleasantly surprised upon checking into our room here. We had purchased the two day bus pass so we could board the #14 bus (as recommended by a Trip Advisor member in the Forum) rather than make the rather long walk with luggage. The rooms were very clean and modern. Be warned that the elevator and enclosed shower are rather small. Also bring eyeshades if you are someone who wakes up as soon as the sun peaks in your window as the windows do not block the light well. The room was quiet, though, as this hotel is located in a residential neighborhood, about a 20+ minute walk from the Duomo. Breakfast consisted of the requisite hard rolls as well as warm croissants, assorted cold cereals, meat and cheeses, individual yogurts, choice of many fruit juices, bottled water and warm beverage (coffee drinks, tea, or hot chocolate) The breakfast attendant re-filled the items as needed as the morning wore on. The hotel also has a bar area midway between the basement breakfast room and the main level if you would like a drink; just ask the person at the front desk and they will act as bartender. The sweeping open stairway makes all levels visible from the lobby. There is free internet access available at the hotel across the street, which the Jane is affiliated with. Another plus is the fact that there are several less expensive but excellent restaurants within a couple blocks. We particularly enjoyed La Taverna, via Cimabue and via Arnolfo, about a four block walk. There are some good restaurants a couple blocks the other direction from the hotel as well.
Reviews.Author: beckywill

Reviews.Content: Pleasant surprise Family run hotel. Free internet across street at sister hotel. 20 minute walk to downtown Florence. Clean rooms. Staff was helpful, but spoke only limited English. Good for price.
Reviews.Author: kmf4003

Reviews.Content: Great rate, good service, good location. Stayed there from July8-10, 2005. You can not get better room and service for this price. I will give Jane an A grade.
Reviews.Author: Darca

Reviews.Content: O.K hotel               More photos
Reviews.Author: risakov

Reviews.Content: Great relation quality-cost I've just arrived from Florence, I have stayed in Hotel Jane for 4 nights and I must say it has been a very nice surprise.The hotel is a bit far away from the center but in 15 minutes you reach the most important touristic spots in the city and you also have a bus if you feel a bit lazy.This is a perfect choice for those travelling alone or who need a single room, they are very affordable (55-60鈧?/night) and rooms are well equipped with: tv, a.c., telephone, mini-bar, etc. and beds are quite large for a single room.Staff is also very kind and most of them speak enough english to understand your needs.Next time I will go to Hotel Jane.Cheers.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great small Hotel, Great Neighborhood This was a great find, a wonderful small hotel just outside the main areas of Florence, at most a 20 minute walk to central Florence, but within easy access by bus. The room was very comfortable and the continental breakfast was excellent. The sevce was very good and the staff very helpful. There were wondeful local restaurants in the area, I would recommend The Tarvena a few blocks away.
Reviews.Author: DaiWeiShi

Reviews.Content: OK hotel OK hotel for the price. Quiet location but far from downtown and you have to take the bus. Room is reasonably sized. The hotel owner is stubborn and charged us for one extra night because we canceled our reservation. Also staff in this hotel hardly speaks any English. I suggest to stay in the hotel across the street (I forgot the name of the hotel) instead. That hotel seems quite nice with free internet in the lobby and friendly staff (including a girl actually speaks English very well).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Cheap find but out of the way! We stayed at Jane for 3 nights and 4 days. Its a really nice hotel but out of the way. Walking time to attractions is about 30 minutes - not 15 or 20 minutes as others claim. I would still recommend this hotel as we saw a lot of non-touristic Florence while finding our ways to the Guamo or Piazzas.If travelling by train, take the 14 number bus from the train station and get off at Via Orcagna. Its 5 minutes from the bus stop. We didnt know which bus to take and no one knows this hotel other than the people who live on Via Orcagna.There is a Coop near the hotel so you can buy water and other essentials for real cheap. I bought 6 1 litre bottles for 1.5 Euros. The staff is very helpful and the breakfast is very nice. The bathrooms are the smallest I have ever seen in my life. I am not big at all and I could barely turn in the shower. I had to get out the same direction I went in. Neighbourhood is safe and they offer internet connection in a hotel accross the street but it never worked while we were staying there.Good hotel otherwise - just be prepared to walk a lot!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great inexpensive place to stay We stayed at Hotel Jane for 3 nights. It was slightly outside the center of Florence but only a quick bus ride away. It was on a quiet street, clean and by far the largest room we had while touring Italy, at only $60 a night. The people working at the front desk were always friendly and you can get free Internet access at the hotel across the street. We found a great restaurant 2 blocks away called La Taverna. It was so good, we ate there all 3 nights while in Florence!
Reviews.Author: CATraveler100

Reviews.Content: great hotel we have stayed in the hotel 4 nights and found it very special for it's unique atmosphere. the distance from the center - merely 15 minutes easy walk - was a great benefit. The nearby restaurant on which they recommend was indeed a nice treat. overall, we highly recommend this hotel
Reviews.Author: orna_7

Reviews.Content: Very good for the value As noted in previous reviews, the Hotel is at some distance from the center, but if you are fit and do not mind walking, all of the essential sights are accessible within 15-20 minutes. The neighborhood is fairly quiet, and there is a supermarket nearby (Coop on via Cimabue).The desk staff is friendly and possess enough English skills to cover the essentials. In my case, I arrived at 11:30, and even though check in was at 2:00, my room was ready in 20 minutes and I was allowed to leave my luggage there. The rooms are impeccably clean, but the walls are indeed a bit thin (even though it's safe to say there's very little noise after about 10pm or so). Each room has a small refrigirator stocked with drinks, that are replenished daily.Breakfast is basic, but plentifull. There is a minibar open 24-7 for a variety of beverages (they will cost you extra).Upon departure, the staff conveniently called a taxi early enough for me to make it to the train station without a hassle.Overall - nice and clean for a budget hotel. Distance is the only drawback, but it's the best deal available through Go-today.
Reviews.Author: vladb

Reviews.Content: Okay Place Hotel Jane was nice, but nothing out of the ordinary. We stayed there because of all the good rewiews here on Trip Advisor so maybe I expected more and got too excited. Let me just make it clear that most of the ratings are too high for this hotel. I am an avid traveler and I also travel on a budget so I don't expect perfection and I'm not overly picky, so here is the honest breakdown-- The pros: The location is in a quiet, safe neighborhood. The staff is very helpful and somewhat friendly, but nothing to get excited about. The breakfast is included in the room, and it consists of pastries, dry cereal, yogurt and limited fruit. Coffee, milk, and juice are also available.The coffee was superb! The room and bathroom were very clean, but small of course. The hotel is right near the river Arno, which you can walk along and take it all the way to the heart of the city. It is a pleasant walk and beats going through town unless you want to make stops along the way. The balconies are a nice plus, you can watch everything going on in the street below. They have awesome shades too that pull down, good for security and block out all light if you want to sleep in. The cons: You will hear every noise from surrounding rooms if they are occupied. You will also hear every sound from the hallway outside your door. We were awakened several times in the middle of the night (2 AM or so) to people coming in. The location- it is FAR from what most people want to see while in Florence. I read a lot about this hike before we went. I love walking so it didn't bother me, but it WILL bother some people, and taxis are expensive (Appx 15 Euro each way). We didn't mind it taking us 30 minutes to walk at a fast pace to the St. Maria station, the center of town. Aside from the hotel itself, most local shops clerks nearby were not friendly at all. (And I speak enough Italian for them to be more considerate. I'm not a rude American.) Do hit La Taverno which is a few blocks away, the front desk will send you there. It was incredibly awesome! Overall, the hotel is great, especially if you are out site seeing all day anyway, but it is nothing more than an average place. I would consider staying there again. (If you are interested in seeing more of the hillside and villages, you should consider staying outside the city. Florence is dirty and overcrowded, you will definitely have to take a tour to see the more beautiful parts of Tuscany. It all depends on what interests you.) I'll post an email if anyone out there has additional questions.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good value We stayed here for two nights. The location seems a bit out of the way, but it really isnt that bad. You are about 10 minutes from Santa Croce (the famous leather school). The rooms are small but they are clean and comfortable. The neighborhood has grocery stores and cheap restaurants for people like me who cant eat out every night. The staff spoke good English. If you need to get on the net, the Orcagna Hotel across the street has a terminal that you can use. Both hotels have the same management.You have to pay for beakfast which we chose not to do. A cheap breakfast of bread cheese and juice was a couple of bucks at the Coop store around the corner.The price was excellent. We booked on a travel site before we left and got the place for about $70 a night.This place isnt the four seasons. But if you can find a nicer cleaner place with a view of the Duomo for the same money, let me know so I can stay there. I am confident you wont find anything close.Logistical notes: The #14 bus is around the corner and goes right to the train station and Duomo. Also the hotel recommends two restaurants. I did read something positive about the Taverna from another writer on this site. I couldnt eat there bcause it closes at 7 PM. The Fuori Pizza is also nice but not as cheap and it opens at 7 PM. For budget travellers, I endorse this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel Jane in Florence Hotel Jane is to be fair - average, the rooms are small but very clean, the bathroom was tiny, the shower was very tiny indeed. The worst thing about the rooms is the fact you can hear everything and I mean everything through the walls, so if you you have excitable or noisy neighbours it could be a very unpleasant stay indeed.The taxi from the station to the hotel on the first night was 10 Euro's. Use buses from then on, its a great way to see the city and get around.The staff at the hotel were pleasant but didn't have great english.A great local restaurant is La Taverna, about 2 mins from the hotel, on the corner of Via Cimabue and Via Arnolfo. It really is fab and worth a visit, the staff were great and the food excellent.Please do speak to people in Italian first, even just saying 'buon giorno' helps. If you speak to them in english you will often get a frosty reception.Notes for getting around - the no 14 bus runs from near the hotel ( turn left and walk down 2 blocks and turn left to the bus stop) to Florence city centre and it a great way of getting around and runs very frequently, purchase your tickets at the tabacci.
Reviews.Author: FaraCar

Reviews.Content: A Wonderful Surprise As part of an extended trip in Italy, my wife and I spent three nights at the Hotel Jane in late October. We were searching for a good economy hotel near the attractions. What we found was better than most three star hotels and comparable to some four star hotels in Italy. Here is my rundown of the good points and other considerations of the place:The Good:(1) The rooms were very clean and the furniture in wonderful shape. A nice plus was a ceiling fan and a reasonably updated bathroom. The maid service was consistently good and we found ourselves with large and clean terrycloth towels every day.(2) Staff was wonderfully helpful in giving directions and information for buses, laundry facilities (which are not on site unfortunately), and information on attractions. Our room was filled with brochures and other helpful tourist information.(3) Breakfast was reaonably good with a selection of pastries, meats, cheese, bread, coffee and other beverages.(4) There is internet access at the nearby sister hotel, Hotel Orcagna (across the street), although it is limited to one computer and one has to watch the tourists who comandeer it (we had to vie with rude German tourists). The service is free. (5) The hotel is close to the attractions in Florence, but not right on top of them. In other words, you find yourself in a pleasant, safe and more quiet neighborhood within fifteen minutes' walk to places like the Uffizi Gallery.Other Considerations:(1) The rooms are indeed small. It would be difficult to put more than two people in a room and I could imagine that if you had loud neighbors, you might hear them. The bathrooms as well are small and equipped really for showers. One has to manuever a bit to use the toilet because of how the space is allocated.(2) For some (beyond 60 years old or disabled), the strolls to the tourist attractions may be too long. My wife and I are healthy and in our 30s and we found the walks pleasant.(3) We did encounter a mosquito or two in the hotel. The ceiling fan was a good antidote to this and we found this issue relatively minor.On the whole, the Jane is a great choice for a tourist in Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Loved Hotel Jane Hotel Jane was great for the money! The staff was very nice and friendly - loved Gianni! I also loved that they did not speak a lot of English too. It was outside the city center, but the bus is right around the corner....14 B and C goes right into the center in like 10 min...not bad! and it is even closer to the Uffizzi...Room was nice and big...I wish we had tried the restaurant down the block though that others were talking about....next time!Jane is also in a very quiet neighborhood...so if you want to stay out at night ...got to catch the last bus!Breakfast was just ok but who cares....all they eat is cereal and bread....I would def recomend Hotel Jane if you want a decent hotel for a good price....you are never in the Hotel anyway!
Reviews.Author: caro242

Reviews.Content: Out of the way, but a good find! We stayed here for just one night in October 2004. We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport  we had a very early flight in the morning. Although we had to walk about 20 minutes to the center of town, or take a short bus ride we would definitely stay here again. The shopping near this hotel was wonderful, it was all locals in a very nice neighborhood. The rooms were large and clean, but needed new carpeting.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great price, location not bad! Thanks for the recommendations, TripAdvisor! Based on what I read here, I decided to book Hotel Jane as my hotel for the Florence portion of my Italy trip. I must say, for what I paid (around $100USD per night) I was thoroughly impressed!The hotel is in a good location -- it's a tad bit outside of the city center, but it is definitely walkable. We decided to use the bus, and the #14 line took my girlfriend and I straight to Duomo every morning for a mere 2 euros total.The rooms were very clean, albeit small - the typical european style hotel room - and the staff was friendly and helpful. The night desk clerk did not speak English, unfortunately ... but that would be my only complaint with the entire stay!I would highly recommend Hotel Jane to any friends traveling to Florence, who are trying to do so on a budget but aren't willing to compromise on cleanliness of their room and the hotel, and friendly staff.Also - one of the other reviewers here mentioned La Taverna as a great nearby restaurant! I wholeheartedly agree! I would like to say a big Thank You to those reviewers, because we positively loved that restaurant and it was very affordable. The staff was very personable, and it truly had the flavor of a restaurant frequented by locals - not tourists!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Perfect Location and Accomodation I just returned from visiting Florence for the first time and made my reservation on line with the Hotel Jane. Since I had no idea where the Jane was situated, I based my reservation on price and ammenities. I was more than pleasantly surprised with Jane's location and accomodations! I had reserved a double room plus a single room and they never recieved confirmation of my double request. BUT they graciously gave me a triple room at a discounted price and I ended up saving money in the long run.I HIGHLY recommend the Hotel Jane as you will not be disappointed in the accommadations, view, breakfast and friendlyness of staff! Kris Keiser of Rowlett, Texas
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Quality accommodation, a great price from Expedia and Free Parking! Excellent! Great hotel! Great location! I read the reviews here before I booked. This was a great resource. The Hotel Jane was great in terms of location, quality and breakfast service. It was outside of the City Center, just a 15 minute walk from the centre of town in a safe area. There was Free parking outside the front of hotel, which is an invaluable amenity in busy Florence. The coffee was great, the room cleanliness and quality was superb, the staff was terrific and the price was right! I highly recommend the Hotel Jane if you want a quality hotel on a budget. Also, be sure to have dinner at this great trattoria, La Taverna. It is located at the corner of Cimabue and Arnolfo. The food was terrific!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: location not all bad... If you are travelling Italy by car, Hotel Jane is a great find. Free parking right in front of the hotel, and a great neighborhood. Other reviews indicate that it is a hike from the city center, but it wasn't that bad. The neighborhood is lovely. Great shopping on a cross-street, and a short walk to the great outdoor market at Piazza Ambrosio. The biggest plus is eating delicious pizza and salads in one of the nearby restaurants completely surrounded by locals, not tourists! Certainly that makes the distance to city center worth it...
Reviews.Author: tessatraveler

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, bit iffy sound insulation We stayed at Hotel Jane for 12 nights and there are good  bad points:The good points :Friendly staffQuiet LocationClean roomsGood Bar (ask for a double if you like spirits, the measures are HUGE !!)Breakfast was good, nothing special, Roberta who served us there was very friendly and helpful.Bad Points:I suppose it all depends who your 'neighbours' are, but, as mentioned in some of the other reviews, the sound insulation is very poor. You can hear every grunt, fart and other sounds (!!) from the rooms next door very clearly. It wasn't helped by a group of Americans who insisted on speaking as loudly as possible whenever they left or entered their room, especially when they came back late at night.To be fair, during the first week we had no people next door either side of us, and the sounds from the other rooms were bareable, especially as it got later at night. If you can, try and get a room not in-between another two, if you know what I mean.Nearly every review goes on about the distance from the hotel to the middle of the city, but to be honest as long as you're not really,really unfit the walk should only take about 20 minutes and even then you walk past loads of shops, pizza places etc...Because they are used by locals, the prices are MUCH better than the city center, where two beers cost 12 euros !To round up, good clean hotel, the ONLY problem of any note being the tissue paper walls.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Charming Nice hotel. Easy to find. A little out of the way but charming and in a nice area on a quiet street. Clean rooms and large for european standards. Comfortable beds.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: 鈥淗otel Jane our favorite in Italy鈥?#x201d; Hotel Jane was our favorite hotel of the trip, though far from the most expensive or most-highly-starred. The room was comfortable and clean, the beds firm, and the air conditioning strong. The hotel is in a quiet, safe neighborhood, within a (long) walking distance from the major attractions. We enjoyed feeding pigeons in a park a couple of blocks away, on the Arno river, that was full of friendly local families. Our favorite restaurant of the trip was a couple of blocks away: La Taverna at the corner of Via Cimabue and Via Anrolfo. It had great food, reasonable prices, and local ambience. Our only (minor) complaint about the hotel was that breakfast was not served until 7:30, which was the latest of any of the six hotels on our trip. This stressed us one morning because we had an early reservation at the Uffizi gallery; and it is a fairly long walk from the Hotel Jane.
Reviews.Author: Heartlander

Reviews.Content: we'd stay there again We just got back from a wonderful stay at the Hotel Jane in Florence. Great deal for the money. I know everyone's big concern is location: trust me, it's fine. Historic Florence is so compact, everything within a one mile radius. Hotel Jane is at the east end of that radius, which is much better than staying at the west end (Santa Maria Novella) among the transients and homeless. Besides, most of the main attractions are only a half-mile away, in the city center. You'll love the walk there among narrow, cobbled streets!Of course, my husband and I are young and like to walk anyway. We also don't usually return to the hotel during the day. One of our days there, we returned 3 times. By the 3rd time, it did began to feel a long way!But we would stay there again if fortunate enough to return. Also, fair breakfast, nice employees.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Bad location, but wonderful hotel.  We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June 2004. We had a three person room, and the room was huge. The room was very clean. We had a wonderful view of the street out in front of us. The main drawback to the hotel was its location--it is a 30 minute walk to any of the tourist sites, so that prohibited us from staying out too late as we didn't want to walk back to our hotel in the dark. However, at least that meant that our hotel room was very quiet since the area of town wasn't very busy. It was a nice, clean area of the city. They had a nice breakfast--plenty of food and pleasant service. The breakfast was included in the price of the room. We got a very good price--99 Euros for a large three person room.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel for price......a very long walk We stayed in this hotel in March 2004. It was one of about 35 on a two month Europe trip. For the price ($60) it was fabulous, however, like the rest of these reviews, it was very very far away. We walked about 30 minutes to get to the Duomo (and we are young!) There is a bus line that comes close however. Also the breakfast in the morning is great, free cappuccinos and a lot of food. The shower was so small though, that I could barely left my arms.
Reviews.Author: zautumn

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, location not as bad as it seems   showReview(2143077, 'full');
